title: Caroline Flack 'the most dangerous celeb to search online due to naked pictures'
text:
Get the biggest celebs stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Caroline Flack has been named the 'most dangerous celebrity' to search for online, according to McAfee.

The 39-year-old Love Island host produces the riskiest results when searched online, with McAfee's research suggesting it unveils sites that could potentially expose their fans to malicious viruses.

The former Strictly Come Dancing champion and Xtra Factor host climbed from fifth place to knock Keeping Up With The Kardashians star, Kim Kardashian , off the UK top spot.

In fact, Kim has tumbled to 26th place in McAfee’s UK Most Dangerous Celebrity list.

Caroline has posted a number of risqué and near naked pics on her Instagram over the past year or so and this has meant that she has been included in a number of 'dangerous' sites.

(Image: carolineflack/Instagram)

Cyber criminals, are having a field day luring unsuspecting consumers to malicious websites that may install malware or steal personal information and passwords.

Raj Samani, chief scientist and McAfee fellow, said: "Caroline Flack has cemented herself as one of TV’s most sought-after hosts.

"After another year of Love Island dominating headlines in the UK, I’m not surprised she has topped this years’ list.

(Image: Instagram)

"People want to keep up to date with the latest pop culture and celebrity news at any time from any device.

"Often consumers put that speed and convenience over security by clicking on suspicious links that promise content featuring our favourite celebrities."

Samani had a warning for those who were looking for Flack content: "Consumers need to think before they click to be sure that they are surfing to safe digital content and protecting themselves from cybersecurity threats that may be used to infect their devices or steal their identity.”

(Image: Instagram)

Trailing Flack in second place is Game of Thrones star Maisie Williams, followed by British export, and Gavin and Stacey creator, James Corden (No.3).

The top 10 celebrities from this year’s study are:

1. Caroline Flack

2. Maisie Williams

3. James Corden

4. Nicki Minaj

5. Billie Eilish

6. Josh Gad

7. Mischa Barton

8. Sam Smith

9. Dua Lipa

10. Liam Hemsworth

McAfee have shared a number of tips to help consumers to stay safe online.

· Be careful what you click. Users looking for a sneak-peek of Frozen 2 starring Josh Gad should be cautious and only stream and download directly from a reliable source. The safest thing to do is to wait for the official release instead of visiting a third-party website that could contain malware.

(Image: Rex Features)

· Refrain from using illegal streaming sites. When it comes to dangerous online behavior, using illegal streaming sites is the equivalent of spreading like wildfire to your device. Many illegal streaming sites are riddled with malware or adware disguised as pirated video files. Do yourself a favor and stream the show from a reputable source.

· Protect your online realm with a cybersecurity solution. This can help protect you from malware, phishing attacks, and other threats.

· Use a Web Reputation tool. Using a Web reputation tool alerts users when they are about to go to a malicious website.

· Use parental control software. Kids are fans of celebrities too, so ensure that limits are set for your child on the devices they use and use parental control software to help minimise exposure to potentially malicious or inappropriate websites.

description: Love Island host Caroline Flack generates the 'riskiest results' and has knocked Kim Kardashian off the top spot
